personal_data.title: Ph.D. in Computational Fluid Dynamics
keywords: Numerical schemes for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD)

professional_experience.title: Research fellow
professional_experience.description: Meshing, anisotropic mesh adaptation and high-order numerical methods

Reynolds-Averaged Navier–Stokes (RANS) and Large Eddy Simulation (LES)

professional_experience.title: Research engineer
objectives: CEDRE is a multi-physics platform working on general unstructured meshes intended to both advance research and process industrial applications in the fields of energetics and propulsion

professional_experience.title: Postdoctoral fellow
professional_experience.description: Time-accurate anisotropic mesh adaptation for fluid-structure interaction (FSI) simulations
objectives: Implementation and validation of the Finite Element method for the unsteady linear elasticity equations
Coupling with a code solving the Euler equations based on the Finite Volume method
Development of error estimates for fluid-structure interaction applied to unsteady anisotropic mesh adaptation
Project RAPID funded by Direction Générale de l'Armement (DGA)

professional_experience.title: Research engineer

objectives: Stability of the Spectral Difference Method

Implementation inside the elsA software of a Riemann solver at the interface

professional_experience.title: Engineering intern
objectives: Effect of the vortex generators on rudder efficiency

professional_experience.title: Engineering intern

education.title: Ph.D. in Computational Fluid Dynamics
education.description: High-order numerical methods for unsteady flows around complex geometries
objectives: Several numerical methods and codes are investigated for industrial applications
The coupling with a nonconforming grid interface of high-order schemes for structured and unstructured zones in elsA
The Spectral Difference Method in JAGUAR
The Lattice Boltzmann Methods in ProLB

education.title: Argonne Training Program on Extreme-Scale Computing (ATPESC)
education.description: Intensive, two-week training on the key skills, approaches, and tools to design, implement, and execute computational science and engineering applications on current high-end computing systems and the leadership-class computing systems of the future
objectives: Approaches to building community codes for HPC systems
Data analysis, visualization, I/O, and methodologies and tools for big data applications

education.title: Classe préparatoire PCSI/PC
education.description: Undergraduate studies in a national preparatory program for entrance into France state run graduate school of engineering

teaching.title: Anisotropic unstructured mesh generation for complex geometries
teaching.description: The course introduces the theoretical background and methods for anisotropic unstructured mesh generation

teaching.title: Incompressible fluid mechanics [MF102]
teaching.description: The goal of this course is to lay out the fundamental concepts and results for incompressible fluid mechanics
objectives: Characteristic quantities of an incompressible flow

teaching.title: Fundamentals to understand and analyze high fidelity compressible Large Eddy Simulation (LES)
teaching.description: This training course enables the participants to reinforce their theoretical knowledge in order to understand and analyze high fidelity compressible Large Eddy Simulation (LES) and hands-on sessions are organized to put the theoretical courses into practice
objectives: Numerical simulation for the Navier-Stokes equations (mesh, discretization methods, data storage)
Signal processing and unsteady turbulence modeling
